intro: Cleistanthus boivinianus f. occidentalis, commonly known as the western cleistanthus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical, glossy leaves. Native to tropical regions of Africa, this plant thrives in warm, humid environments. It is often found in coastal areas and lowland forests, where it contributes to the local biodiversity. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
